tenderoffers.Reinvestment:
Reinvestment in ParentCo of Bidder and in the majority shareholder of ParentCo 

Co-founders reinvestment  in ParentCo of Bidder 
Investment agreement providing for: 
(i) the contribution in kind by one co-founder of the shares of its holding company to DLPV Software, ParentCo of Bidder,  in exchange for ordinary shares with warrants attached (ABAA) and bonds convertible in preferred shares with warrants attached (OCADPBAA)
(ii) the contribution in kind by the other co-founder of Bidder's shares to ParentCo e in exchange for ABAA and preferred shares with warrants attached (ADPBAA)
(iii) the sale or contribution of additional shares by the co-founders  in exchange for ABAA and ADPBAA of ParentCo to be completed 45 days following the end of the offer and, as the case may be, the squeeze out ((same valuation as (ii) above)
(iv) in the event of an additional investment of the financial investors, the co-founders may invest pari passu in cash with the financial investors in order to avoid dilution 

Valuation: Pari passu, price to be calculated in transparency with the offer price. 

Liquidity:  lock-up 3 years. Total exit right to the benefit of the founders in case of significant disagreement provided in the SHA which does not qualify as a put option (see SHA in Other agreements). Valuation: formula equal to the EBITDA multiple retained for the offer price and taking in account the net debt  

Managers reinvestment in ParentCo of Bidder and in the majority shareholder of ParentCo 
Within 45 days following the end of the offer and, as the case may be, the squeeze out:
(i) Contribution of (a) Bidder's shares to DLPV Software in exchange for ordinary shares and (b) Target shares to DLPV Software and 2A Software (majority shareholder of DLPV Software) in exchange for ratchet preferred shares (ADP P) of 2A Software and ordinary shares of DLPV Software.
Valuation : Pari passu, price to be calculated in transparency with the offer price. 

(ii) Undertaking from the managers to contribute a portion of their Target free shares subject to lock up period to DLPV Software in exchange for ordinary shares as from January 2018. 
Valuation:  Undertaking from DLPV Software to purchase the remaining free shares at a price equal to the offer price maximum

Liquidity: call and put option in case of departure. No guaranteed price provided for in the by-laws or the SHA 

Squeeze out intent: yes - Squeeze out completed: yes

Valuation: formula equal to the EBITDA multiple retained for the offer price and taking in account the net debt. No guaranteed price provided for in the by-laws or the SHA

Yes 
 
Top up  to be paid if within 12 months of the clearance of the offer, the Bidder file a new tender offer for Target shares and/or purchase on or off market Target shares at a price higher than the offer price. Top up equal to 100% of the difference between the revised price and the offer price.
tenderoffers.Squeeze out Kicker% of the Offer Price:
Yes 
4.53% 

Squeeze out kicker is due to the sellers of the block and the shareholders that have tendered their shares to the offer if Bidder crosses the 95% threshold within 12 months following (i) the clearance of the offer or any subsequent offer, or (ii) any purchase on or off the market. 

Squeeze out kicker is not due if the 95% threshold is reached following a new offer or market purchases at a price higher than the offer price

tenderoffers.Comments:
Background: the bidder invested in Target in October 2014 (66.5%), initiated a tender offer for Target shares in December 2015 (87.87%). Subsequently, the treasury shares were cancelled in February 2016 which resulted in a reduction of the share capital, the bidder acquired two blocks in July 2016 and the registered office was transferred from Luxemburg to the UK in November 2016. As the bidder owns more than 80%, it will perform a compulsory transfer under English laws of the shares not tendered to the offer.

* Purchase of 2.45% of the shares on the market between filing and clearance. % owned at clearance: 93.79% of the shares and voting rights

**At the end of the offer the bidder will initiate a compulsory transfer of the non tendered shares to the majority shareholder as provided or by the articles of association of Target. This procedure is available as the bidder owns more than 80% of the share capital.

*** Several liquidity mechanisms put in place:
(1) BSAR that can be exercised as from the date of the opening of the offer: put option at the offer price (fixed price)
(2) BSAR that cannot be exercised as from the date of the opening of the offer: two liquidity mechanisms at the election of the holder of the BSAR:
(i)(a) put option at the price determined by an expert ; (b) put and call option in case of a change of control at a price equal to the purchase price of the majority stake
(ii) 3 year extension of the exercisable period of the BSAR and  put and call option in case of a change of control at a price equal to the purchase price of the majority stake
Undertaking from a manager not to exercise its BSAR during the offer period

tenderoffers.Litigation/Complaints relating to the of:
Yes 
Minority shareholders have challenged the offer and the offer price. They have wrote to the AMF and met the independent expert. They have also sought the nullity of the AMF clearance decision before the Paris Court of Appeal. The closing of the offer has been postponed. The AMF was authorized by the court to close temporarily the offer and to reopen it if the court confirmed the AMF clearance decision. The court rejected the minority shareholders request and the offer was reopened for 10 days.
tenderoffers.Comments:
Background: Target is willing to delist since 2010. The liquidity of Target shares being very low, Target has been authorized to delist by Euronext on December 2016. According to Euronext rules, delisting may be requested only following a cash tender offer provided that (i) the bidder holds at least 90% of the voting right and (ii) the issuer can demonstrate he very low liquidity. Following a share capital reduction, the family Gattaz concert held 92.17% of the share capital and 95.80% of the voting rights, consequently Target has asked them to file a cash tender offer. Target has undertaken to repurchase the shares that will be bought in connection with the offer so that Bidder may refinance the credit used to acquire the shares. The repurchased shares will be cancelled.

* Bidder has requested the independent expert to review the fairness of the offer for the shareholders willing to tender as well for those willing to remain shareholder of the company.

** The offer price has been increased between filing and clearance  

*** Following a share capital reduction completed in October 2016 prior to the offer.

tenderoffers.Other Agreements (Call option, SHA...):
(i) Framework Agreement between Bidder and Thales Avionics. Thales Avionics has been approached by Bidder but wished to remain shareholder of Target. The Framework agreement provides that (a) if the Bidder acquires more than 50% of Target but less than 2/3, Bidder and Thales reserve the right to negotiate a sale or a contribution by Thales Avionics to Bidder of a number of Target shares enabling the Bidder to cross the 2/3 threshold and (b) in the event the offer is successful, Bidder and Thales Avionics will enter into a shareholders' agreement which will qualify as a concert.
(ii) Shareholder Agreement:  the shareholders agreement between Bidder and Thales will become effective on the settlement date of the offer. The shareholders' agreement provides for (a) governance rules (including a veto right on important decision), (b) a lock up period, a pre-emption right, a tag along and drag along right and anti-dilution provisions, (c) call and put option relating to the Target shares owned by Thales Avionics and (d) specific undertakings from the Bidder relating the preservation of the sensitive activities of Target and a right of Thales Avionics to request a carve out of the sensitive activities in the event of a breach by Bidder.
(iii) Purchase agreement of the shares underlying the stock options and BSPCE: in the event the offer is successful, Bidder has agreed with some holder of stock options and BSPCE to finance their exercise of the stock options and BSPCE and to immediately purchase the shares issued upon such exercise at the offer price. These purchase agreement should be entered into prior to the close of the offer.

tenderoffers.Litigation/Complaints relating to the of:
Yes 
Minority shareholders wrote to the AMF to request that the OCEANES should benefit from an adjustment of their exchange ratio in the manner as in the exchange offer (OPE) which closed in February 2016. The AMF did not accept this request and cleared the offer. Some shareholders have filed a request for cancellation of the AMF clearance decision with the Paris Court of Appeals and requested a revision of the offer price. Consequently, the close of the offer was postponed. 
Nokia took several undertakings in order to allow the offer to close not waiting the final decision of the court. First, Nokia undertook until the final decision of the court is issued (i) to block in a bank account the amount of the additional price required, (ii) to lock up the shares acquired within the offer in case they would have to be returned and (iii) to maintain the integrity of Target. Second, Nokia undertook (i) to return the securities acquired within the OPR-RO if requested by the holders, (ii) to file an amended OPR-RO complying with the Court of appeals requirements and (iii) to pay an additional price to the holders that did not request the return of their securities, in the event the Court of appeals would be cancel or amend the AMF clearance decision.
tenderoffers.Comments:
* Background: Nokia filed an exchange offer (OPE) for Alcatel Lucent shares in October 2015. The 95% threshold was not reached at the close of the OPE, despite the fact that Nokia exercised all the OCEANES she owned on the settlement date of the offer. From February to June 2016, Nokia purchased or exchanged (at the OPE exchange ratio) shares and OCEANES off the market and reached the 95% threshold for the shares and the OCEANES enabling Nokia to file a repurchase offer followed by a squeeze out (OPR-RO).

** Liquidity mechanism were put in place in connection with the 2015 OPE. 

*** The Board of Target was advised by Sullivan & Cromwell.

tenderoffers.Comments: * Background:  Bidder completed a simplified cash offer in June 2016 and did not reached the 95% threshold at the end of the offer (Offer price 20€ per share). Bidder subsequently crossed the 95% threshold at the end of July 2016 following (i) purchases on the market and off market and (ii) the cancellation of a portion of treasury shares which resulted in a share capital reduction. These purchases were made at the offer price of the initial cash offer (20€). Bidder then filed a repurchase offer followed by a squeeze out (OPR-RO) at a price of 20€ per share.

The Works Council has appointed a chartered accountant. Its report is also included in the response document. 

*** The MOU also provided, inter alia, for (i) several provisions pertaining to enable holders of stock options and performance shares to participate to the offer, (ii) liquidity mechanism, (iii) cooperation in order to obtain regulatory approvals, (iv) ordinary course of business undertakings, (v) restrictions on dividend distributions and (vi) a standstill.

tenderoffers.Offer Conditions Mandatory Level of acce:
>50% of the share capital or voting rights (taking into account the securities tendered to the US offer) 

Bidder undertook to convert on the settlement of the offer a number of tendered OCEANEs in order to reach this threshold. The conversion of the OCEANEs will be deemed to have occurred on the closing date of the offer. 

The numerator will included (i) the tendered shares, (ii) the shares likely to be issued upon exercise of the tendered OCEANEs and (iii) the treasury shares owned by Target and its subsidiaries.
tenderoffers.Offer Conditions Optional Level of acce:
>50% of the shares and voting rights calculated on a fully diluted basis on the date of the announcement of the results of the offer taking into account the results of the US offer. 

The numerator will included (i) the tendered shares and (ii) the shares likely to be issued upon exercise of the tendered OCEANEs 

Possible waiver of this optional level of acceptances until the publication by the AMF of the final results of the offer taking into account the US offer.

tenderoffers.Comments:
Background: Purchase from the founders of a block of Target shares (41.91 %) and reinvestment of certain founders through a contribution of Target shares (30.08 %) to the Bidder. 

* It was argued that Rothschild had acted in the interest of all shareholders. Therefore it was fair that the amount of the fees be borne by all shareholders.

** The free shares were subject to performance conditions. These conditions have been removed in connection with the transaction.  The final granting will only depend on whether the employee is still with Target or not. 
*** If fair value < offer price, the holder may, at this election, (i) contribute all its Target shares to the Bidder at the fair value or (ii) sell all its Target shares at the offer price to the Bidder.
If fair value > offer price, contribution of all its Target shares at fair value. FV= EV - Financial Debt

* Target was purchased by Bidder in 2017 (block purchase followed by a tender offer). The offer is made in the context of a refinancing of the debt of Tessi and the payment of an exceptional dividend and interim dividend pertaining to distribute the proceed of the sale of a shareholding held by Target. This offer  will offer an immediate liquidity to Target shareholders in the context of low liquidity, a change in the balance sheet structure and an increase of the indebtedness and a refocusing of the activities of Target.

Boussard & Gavaudan (BG) entities invested in Target in December 2014 by subscribing shares with warrants attached (ABSA). The holding in Target have been transferred to the Bidder, part of the BG group, from another BG entity. Mr and Mrs Salik, M. Meeus and Bidder and other BG entities owned warrants (BSA) exercisable until 9 June 2016. They have decided to enter into a shareholders' agreement relating to the exercise of the BSA in order to increase the shareholders' equity and finance the development of Target. The shareholders' agreement qualified as a concert. The concert crossed the 50% threshold which triggered the mandatory filing of a tender offer.

Background: merger of equals. The squeeze out was subject to a new AMF clearance and was performed within three months following the offer,

* Combination agreement In July 2014, Bidder and Target  entered into a combination agreement whereby they would jointly prepare the filing in France of a OPE. The exchange ratio was subsequently amended in March 2015.  If the offer is successful, Bidder and Target  agreed that a dividend payable in shares would be distributed to all Holcim-Lafarge shareholders following settlement of the reopened exchange offer. 
The agreement also provides for (i) a reciprocal break-up fee amounting to 350M€, (ii) the sale of certain entities or assets to rebalance the portfolio of the new Group resulting from the merger of the two companies and to anticipate some potential regulatory issues, (iii) the listing of Bidder on Euronext Paris, (iv) governance provisions.

tenderoffers.Other Agreements (Call option, SHA...):
(i) Call Option granted by Apax and BG (the sellers) to Bidder over their remaining shares which can be exercised as from the completion of the second block purchase and until the publication of the 2017 audited financial statements in 2018. The exercise price is equal to the offer price for the first year and subsequently determined pursuant to a formula with a minimum price of 8.5€ (offer price) and a cap equals to 9.35€.
(ii) Put Option granted by the Bidder to Apax and BG (the sellers) over a maximum of 20% of the Target share capital. The put option can be exercised in 2018, for a three-month period following expiration of the exercise period of the call option. The put option price is equal to the offer price subject that Target 2017 results amount to 42M€.
(iii) Shareholders' Agreement relating to Target between Bidder and Apax and BG providing for governance rules of Target, call and put option described above, a lock-up period for the Bidder, right of first offer (ROFO) to the benefit of the Bidder, liquidity rights for Apax and BG and dividend distribution. 
(iv) Share Purchase Agreement providing for the sale of a number of shares enabling the Bidder to own 51% of the share capital and voting rights following the offer (second block purchase) at a price equivalent to the offer price
(v) Shareholders' Agreement between the sellers providing for (a) a concertation prior to exercise their rights under the Shareholders' agreement concluded with the Bidder, (b) coordination regarding the exercise of the put option granted the Bidder, the right of first offer of the Bidder and the liquidity rights, (c) concertation within an ad hoc committee prior to any board or shareholders meeting decision, (d) share transfer restriction and (e) information undertaking relating to any transaction that would result in Apax and BG owning less than 15% of Target share capital and pre-emption right. Duration 7 years

tenderoffers.Liquidity Agreements with shareholdersFi:
Yes 
The TOA provides that, in the event that the liquidity of the Target shares on the market is significantly reduced following the offer, Bidder will put in place liquidity agreement for the holders of free shares that are subject to a lock up period that has not expired. 

The liquidity mechanism will be call and put option that cannot be exercised if the float represents 10% or more of the number of shares.

Price of the Call Option will be the lower between (i) the offer price and (ii) the offer price multiplied by the ratio between the latest net consolidated results and the 2015 net consolidated results.
Price of the Put Option will be the offer price. However the put can be exercised only if the value of the free shares is equal or higher to the offer price.

tenderoffers.Offer Conditions Mandatory Level of acce:
Exemption Art. 231-9, I, 2° 

The Bidder obtained from the AMF to be exempted from reaching the mandatory 50% threshold because (i) Bidder owned 28.46% of Target and controlled the sole manager (gérant commandité) and (ii) the shares that  could be tendered to the offer were limited to 9.21%. Therefore reaching the 50% threshold would have implied a tendering rate of 75%.

Yes 
No shop 
Break-up fee equal to 1.9% of the value of Target, to be paid by Target if: 
(i) the offer is not recommended by Target board (except if no fairness opinion is issued)

tenderoffers.Management Package or other advantages:
Three individual sellers benefitted from the following management package provided for in the SPA: 
Employment agreement: 
If the 95% threshold is reached, Bidder's undertaking to enter into new employment agreement with each individuals sellers and the DG. The new employment agreement will provide for a non compete undertaking

Management position/agreement
If the 50% mandatory threshold is reached but not the 95%, Bidder undertakes, in its capacity as majority shareholder, to enter into a management agreement relating to the position of Chairman of the board with one of the seller and a management agreement relating to the position of DG

Free shares:
If the 50% mandatory threshold is reached, Bidder's undertaking to:
(i) grant Bidder's Canadian Restricted Share Units (RSU) to the sellers and 
(ii) cancel of 2018 Target free shares of the DG planned to be granted in 2018 and replace them by Bidder's RSU.
2016 and 2017 Target free shares granted to the DG are covered by a liquidity agreement

The latter two capital increases were paid by a set off resulting from the assignment from Euro Disney Investments SAS and EDL Corporation SAS to the Target of the receivables them have over Euro Disney Associés SCA, the main operational subsidiary of the Euro Disney Group.
These capital increases are part of a wider recapitalisation plan including also the decrease of the debt of the Euro Disney Group.

tenderoffers.Comments: * Background: The Bidder filed a "Garantie de cours" for Target shares in April 2009 and owned 80.88% of Target share capital at the end of the offer.  Since this offer, Bidder has (i) purchased shares on the market between June 2009 and November 2011, (ii) made a contractual voluntary tender offer not submitted to AMF clearance in April 2012, (iii) continued market purchases between August 2012 and February 2013 and (iv) purchased a 5.57% block from Halisol. As a resulted Bidder increased its shareholding to 94.74% of Target share capital and 96.38% of the voting rights. Thanks to the concert with Mr Brun and Mr Couly, the Bidder was able to file this buy-out offer followed by a squeeze out (OPR-RO).

tenderoffers.Comments:
* Background: Target was owned by three families (26.07%) and Banque Populaire de Développement (27.43%). The families wanted to sell gradually their holding in Target and Naxicap Partners, indirect shareholder of Target for 17 years, was willing to increase its shareholdings in Target. To this effect, these shareholders have considered to contribute/sell their Target shares to an SPV, i.e. the Bidder. 

** As a result of the purchases on the market and the acquisition of 1.8% from certain shareholders between filing and clearance, Bidder owned 65.24% of Target prior to clearance. 

*** Bidder did not reach the 95% thresold and could not complete a squeeze out. Target will remain listed until 2017.  Bidder will be bought in 2017 and has filed a new OPAS over Target shares in November 2017.

tenderoffers.Comments:
* Background: Bidder purchased from Bolloré group 59.21% of Target in July 2017 and filed a simplified cash offer (OPAS) in September 2017. Bidder announced that it had no intent to complete a squeeze out. Bidder did not reached the 95% threshold at the end of the offer (offer price 9.25€ per share). 
In October 2017, Bidder accepted an offer to purchase an additional 1.6% of the Target's capital share and owned 96.15% of Target share capital. Subsequently, Bidder considered that the float was not enough to ensure the liquidity of Target shares and announced its intent to file a buy-out offer followed by a squeeze out (OPR-RO) at a price of 9.25€ per share in November 2017.

tenderoffers.Top Up (droit de suite) granted to the S:
Yes 
Top up to be paid upon the completion of the squeeze out in the event the squeeze out price would be higher than the value of Target shares exchanged for Bidder's shares. Top equals to 100% of the difference after deduction of the increase of the stock price of the Bidder's shares remitted in exchange between the conclusion of the exchange and the completion of the squeeze out. Top up may be paid in cash or shares.

tenderoffers.Comments:
Background:  Bidder acquired 90.50% of Target following a block purchase and a tender offer in 2016. Subsequently, Bidder acquired 0.16% on the market following the 2016 offer and raised its shareholding up to 90.66%. Bidder announced in May 2017 its intent to transform Target SA into a SE and that it was actively reviewing the possibility to transfer the registered office to the Netherlands. Bidder's board also stated that it was favorable to a delisting of Target. Bidder filed a new offer in June 2017 at a price 41% higher than the 2016 offer price. Bidder also obtained an undertaking to tender 5.04% of the share capital to the offer from four shareholders, which ensured the Bidder to reach the 95% squeeze out threshold.

* Tenders to a simplified tender offer are irrevocable. The Bidder agreed with the four shareholders that the tenders should occur on the first business day following the opening of the offer.
